snippet: Cardinal Stanislaw Dziwisz, who was secretary to John Paul II, has drawn criticism for defying the pope’s order in his will to destroy his notes, instead publishing them as a book.
abstract: Cardinal Stanislaw Dziwisz, who was secretary to John Paul II, has drawn criticism for defying pope’s order in his will to destroy his notes, instead publishing them as a book entitled I Am Very Much in God's Hands.

byline.contributor: Mateusz Zurawik contributed reporting from Warsaw.
